title: The Trick to a Crisp, Juicy Chicken Cutlet Is So Satisfying for the Cook
sub_head: Pound that chicken with every ounce of stress inside you, until it’s a uniform ¼-inch thick. Breaded and fried, the cutlet will serve as the centerpiece for this classic Mexican torta milanesa recipe.
body:
SANDWICHES ARE something of a specialty for Philadelphia chef Cristina Martinez. For a time in her native Mexico, she sold hand-held meals like this torta milanesa along with fresh-pressed juices out of her mother’s kitchen.
In Ms. Martinez’s final Slow Food Fast recipe, the centerpiece is the chicken milanesa, a cutlet pounded thin, breaded and fried to a crisp golden brown. Served on a roll slathered in mayonnaise and refried beans, with toppings of avocado, tomato and shredded lettuce, it hits all the marks: salty, crunchy, fresh, creamy. A garnish of pickled jalapeños isn’t mandatory, but it does add a great kick.
